newsitem.title: CROATIA: Supreme Court head blasts his removal as illegal.
newsitem.headline: Supreme Court head blasts his removal as illegal.

text.p: The head of Croatia's supreme court blasted the authorities on Wednesday for removing him from the post the day before, saying the decision was illegal and politically motivated.
The National Judicial Council's disciplinary committee on Tuesday suspended Krunislav Olujic, alleging that he tainted the Supreme Court's reputation by maintaining sexual relations with minors.
But Olujic replied in a statement on Wednesday that the desicion was "undoubtedly politically motivated... and serves primarily to do away with political opponents".
Apparently ignoring the sexual charges, Olujic claimed the disciplinary committee was formed illegally, without consulting relevant legal bodies.
"This damages the constitutional principle of independence of courts," said the statement, carried by state news agency HINA.
